result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Linsenbigler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael A Linsenbigler in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews PQWOR with Defendant.  Court informs of firearms restriction and voting ineligibility.  Court informs of charge/penalty.  DE pleads guilty to count 1.  Court finds plea made FVI made, accepts plea and finds guilty of count 1.  Atty. Thompson is heard on recommendation.  Atty. Jansen is heard.  Mr. Linsenbiegler heard.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:

Sentence withheld
2 years probation with conditions:
$1000 fine plus costs, to be paid at rate of $25 per month starting 10/1/16;
AODA and follow thru,
Absolute sobriety,
Not possess controlled substance without valid prescription.
DNA Sample.

Can report to P&P by the close of business tomorrow.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael A Linsenbigler in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Michael A Linsenbigler in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Officer Michael Roehl, s/t; witness excused; State moves for bindover and Atty. Jansen moves to dismiss; Court finds over to Br.3; Argn set; bond cont.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:09 - Defendant Michael A Linsenbigler in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
